data.q: What is Django primarily used for?
data.e: Django is a high-level Python web framework designed for rapid web application development.

data.q: Which design philosophy does Django strongly follow?
data.e: Django emphasizes the DRY principle to reduce duplication and improve maintainability.

data.q: What architectural pattern does Django use?
data.e: Django uses the MVT (Model-View-Template) pattern, a variation of MVC.

data.q: Which command is used to create a new Django project?
data.e: django-admin startproject initializes a new Django project structure.

o: A reusable component providing specific functionality
data.e: A Django app is a modular, reusable component within a project.

data.q: Which file is used to define URL routes in a Django app?
data.e: urls.py maps URL patterns to view functions or classes.

data.q: What is the primary role of Django models?
o: Define database schema and data logic
data.e: Models define database structure and handle data-related logic using Django ORM.

data.q: Which Django feature automatically generates an admin interface?
data.e: Django Admin provides a built-in web interface for managing models.
Django ORM allows database interaction using Python objects instead of raw SQL.

data.q: Which file contains global configuration for a Django project?
data.e: settings.py stores project-wide configuration such as databases, middleware, and installed apps.
